message_1: Consider the following proposition: "If it is a holiday, then the museum is closed." Suppose it is not a holiday and the museum is closed. Is the proposition true or false?
message_2:
The proposition is still true. The given statement is an implication, which can be written in the form "If P, then Q," where P represents "it is a holiday" and Q represents "the museum is closed." In this case, P is false (it is not a holiday) and Q is true (the museum is closed).

An implication is considered false only when P is true and Q is false. In all other cases, including the one given (P is false and Q is true), the implication is considered true. So, the proposition "If it is a holiday, then the museum is closed" is true in this scenario.
